item.title: The first HTC One will get Sense 6 in US and Canada by the end of May
item.description: Sorry, HTC, we're still not going to call it the "Sixth Sense." That's the phone maker's name for Sense 6, the latest version of its Android user interface. For the uninitiated, this is the update that comes preloaded on the new HTC One (M8) but is...
item.dc:creator: Brad Molen

item.title: Banksy's latest works tackle technology, surveillance and our crumbling humanity
item.description: They say that the best art imitates life, and let's be honest, our lives are increasingly controlled by technology. After tackling war, human rights and censorship, legendary and anonymous street artist Banksy is now turning his critical eye on our...
item.dc:creator: Terrence O'Brien

item.title: This is how Samsung thinks normal people use smartwatches
item.description: Samsung's track record on smartwatch marketing has been, shall we say, mixed. Its nostalgic sci-fi TV spot for the Galaxy Gear was a hit, but its awkward (and slightly creepy) romantic skier ad? Not so much. Give credit to the company for learning...
item.dc:creator: Jon Fingas

item.title: Leaked icons indicate Android may enjoy a redesign soon
item.description: The Google I/O developer conference is just over two months away, but it's never too early to start opining about what the software giant is planning to show. Try not to be overwhelmed with excitement, kids: according to documents leaked by Android...
item.dc:creator: Brad Molen

item.title: Snowden leaks and NSA reporting win Pulitzer Prizes
item.description: Both The Guardian and The Washington Post were announced as Pulitzer Prize winners today in the public service category. The prizes were awarded for The Guardian's Edward Snowden work, which revealed dozens of details about the United States...
item.dc:creator: Ben Gilbert

item.title: Anyone can sign up to buy Google Glass tomorrow; will you?
item.description: Tomorrow, as most everyone in the US knows, is tax day. It's also the one day where Google will open up the sale of its Glass wearable to the general public, meaning you won't need that Explorer invite to nab a pair. What you will need is $1,500, a...
item.dc:creator: Sarah Silbert

item.title: Netflix speeds soar on Comcast following controversial deal
item.description: The past few months have been very active for Netflix, as it's faced new challenges with getting its video streams into homes. It responded to customer complaints and dropping average speeds by making a new connection deal with Comcast, while others...
item.dc:creator: Edgar Alvarez

item.title: Engadget Podcast 392: The whiskey 'sode
item.description: After a chance meeting with Distiller app co-founder Mikael Mossberg and in-house whiskey expert Stephanie Moreno at this year's SXSW event, a unique podcast concept was born. In this Very Special Episode, our guests serve as spirit guides, taking us...
item.dc:creator: Jon Turi

item.title: Mozilla picks interim CEO as it tries to move past controversy
item.description: Previous CEO Brendan Eich lasted just 11 days as head of the Firefox company. He resigned last week amid political backlash; Eich contributed $1,000 to California's controversial Proposition 8, a bill that would've ended the legality of same-sex...
item.dc:creator: Ben Gilbert

item.title: Watch SpaceX's ambitious launch of a reusable rocket (update: launch scrubbed)
item.description: Haste makes waste, and you have to move awfully fast to break out of Earth's atmosphere. After today, however, space travel might be a tad more sustainable. SpaceX is testing a new, reusable version of its Falcon 9 rocket today. The test is tacked on...
item.dc:creator: Sean Buckley

item.title: Google beats Facebook to acquisition of drone maker
item.description: Google has just agreed to buy Titan Aerospace, a maker of high-altitude solar-powered drones that was in acquisition talks with Facebook just a few months ago. According to the Wall Street Journal, the Mountain View company hopes to use these...
item.dc:creator: Nicole Lee

item.title: Prime-time TV enjoys its highest ratings since 2007
item.description: The drastic change in the way people consume media has stirred up the argument that TV as we knew it is dead. But while prime-time ratings have dipped since the rise of services like Netflix and solid programming from networks such as AMC and HBO,...
item.dc:creator: Edgar Alvarez

item.title: Crooks use Heartbleed exploit to steal 900 Canadian tax IDs
item.description: While it might not be the worst-case scenario, a security breach at the Canada Revenue Agency could be the worst known real-world exploit of the Heartbleed vulnerability since it went global last week. The CRA claims that almost 1,000 Social...
item.dc:creator: James Trew

item.title: LogAnalysis maps the structure of gangs using phone records
item.description: It's no surprise that law enforcement agencies use mobile phone records to investigate criminal activity, but a platform called LogAnalysis could facilitate some of the most sophisticated analysis for all that raw data. Developed by Emilio Ferrara...
item.dc:creator: Sarah Silbert

item.title: A total lunar eclipse is happening tonight, and here's how you can watch
item.description: You may have a good excuse to stay up late tonight. A rare total lunar eclipse, where the Earth casts a shadow over the entire Moon, is due to start at 12:53AM Eastern. Our celestial neighbor should be completely enshrouded by 3:06AM, producing an...
item.dc:creator: Jon Fingas

item.title: Swedish students cook up a way to pay with your hands
item.description: Big companies have been trying to make in-store payments with mobile devices a thing for years, which makes Frederik Leifland's approach awfully refreshing by comparison. There's no smartphone, no NFC chip, no apps involved here -- all you need to...
item.dc:creator: Chris Velazco

item.title: The UK's stolen phone market is as healthy as ever
item.description: It may be easy to report and track stolen smartphones in the UK, but that's not preventing some of the country's shops from selling these ill-gotten handsets. A BBC undercover operation has revealed that at least eight stores in London are willing to...
item.dc:creator: Jon Fingas

item.title: T-Mobile is killing overages on all plans starting this June
item.description: T-Mobile hasn't quite been as UnCarrier as some would like. Despite the network's turn toward overage-free service, there's still occasional chances that you'll pay extra for heavy use -- especially if you're on a grandfathered plan. That won't be a...
item.dc:creator: Jon Fingas

item.title: Facebook's making moves to challenge PayPal
item.description: After attempts to kickstart its own virtual currency stalled, Facebook may soon get into the business of sending real money between you and your friends. According to The Financial Times, the social network is "only weeks away" from receiving the...
item.dc:creator: Matt Brian

item.title: BBC's Sport app now delivers real-time goal notifications
item.description: While the BBC's Vidiprinter dutifully does its job providing us with all of the goals around the grounds, many have ditched TV and now use a smartphone to check the latest football results. The BBC Sport app has done a stellar job at providing live...
item.dc:creator: Matt Brian

item.title: The 'world's smallest' laptop adapter debuts on Kickstarter for $79
item.description: Back at CES in January, MIT spin-off FINsix unveiled the "world's smallest" 65W laptop adapter, and it even managed to nab a nomination for our Best Startup award. Fast forward to today, the company is launching this nifty device -- now dubbed the...
item.dc:creator: Richard Lai

item.title: UN: fixing climate change is affordable
item.description: One of the biggest arguments against fixing climate change is that it would cost too much. Not so, says the UN's climate change panel, which has found that abandoning fossil fuels would only knock around 0.06 percent off the world's GDP. According to...
item.dc:creator: Daniel Cooper

item.title: Windows Phone 8.1 review: Microsoft's mobile OS finally feels whole
item.description: Android, iOS, Windows Phone. Each of these mobile platforms had to start somewhere, and none were anywhere near perfect on the first try. Fortunately, each OS gets better with every iteration until, at some point, it all just clicks. Arguably,...
item.dc:creator: Brad Molen

item.title: Microsoft offers early download of Windows Phone 8.1
item.description: We get it. You want to download Windows Phone 8.1 as soon as possible just to see if Cortana is really as cool on a mobile device as she is in the Halo series. Or, perhaps it's the new Action Center and swipe keyboard that strike your fancy. Whatever...
item.dc:creator: Brad Molen

item.title: Amazon brings BBC's Sherlock, Dr. Who and more to Prime Instant Video
item.description: Amazon's Prime Instant Video streaming service is no stranger to BBC content, but today the two have inked a new deal to bring more British TV shows to the platform formerly known as LoveFilm. There are a bunch of seasons of Sherlock and Doctor Who...
item.dc:creator: Jamie Rigg
